com.ingenico.pclutilities

Class PclUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ingenico.pclutilities.PclUtilities

  • public class PclUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that allows management of Ingenico terminals

    • Nested Class Summary

        public boolean AddAuthorizedBTAddr(java.lang.String pAddr)
        Add Authorized Bluetooth Address
        Parameters:
        pAddr - Bluetooth Address format "xx:xx:xx:"
        Returns:
        true if added and false if bad parameter

                                   int pid)
        Add Authorized USB Vid/Pid
        Parameters:
        vid - Vendor ID
        pid - Product ID
        Returns:
        true if vid/pid added else false

        Parameters:

      • GetPairedCompanions

        public java.util.Set<PclUtilities.BluetoothCompanion> GetPairedCompanions()
        Get the list of Ingenico paired terminals.
        Returns:
        A set of BluetoothCompanion containing Ingenico paired terminals
        See Also:
        PclUtilities.BluetoothCompanion

      • isIngenicoBtDevice

        public static boolean isIngenicoBtDevice(java.lang.String btAddr)
        Returns whether a Bluetooth address corresponds to an Ingenico terminal.
        Parameters:
        btAddr - Bluetooth address, formatted XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX
        Returns:
        true if the Bluetooth address corresponds to an Ingenico terminal

      • ActivateCompanion

        public int ActivateCompanion(java.lang.String sBtAddress)
        Activate a Bluetooth paired Ingenico terminal.
        Parameters:
        sBtAddress - Ingenico terminal Bluetooth address, formatted XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX. This address can be retrieved with GetPairedCompanions.
        Returns:
        0 in case of success, 1 in case of failure

      • getUsbDevices

        public java.util.Set<android.hardware.usb.UsbDevice> getUsbDevices()
        Get connected Ingenico USB devices.
        Returns:
        A set of UsbDevice or null if USB host is not supported
        See Also:
        UsbDevice

      • getSerialPortDevices

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSerialPortDevices()
        Get connected Ingenico serial port devices.
        Returns:
        A set of SerialPort or empty if access to RS232 port is not supported

      • getSerialPortCompanion

        public PclUtilities.SerialPortCompanion getSerialPortCompanion(java.lang.String device)
        Get SerialPortCompanion object from an serial port device.
        Parameters:
        device - An serial port path
        Returns:
        An SerialPortCompanion
        See Also:
        PclUtilities.SerialPortCompanion

      • activateSerialPortCompanion

        public int activateSerialPortCompanion(java.lang.String device,
                                       java.lang.String name)
        Activate an Ingenico terminal connected through RS232.
        Parameters:
        device - serial port device path. This device can be retrieved with getSerialPortCompanion.
        name - Ingenico terminal name. This name can be retrieved with getSerialPortCompanion.
        Returns:
        0 in case of success, 1 in case of failure

      • getIPTerminals

        public java.util.Set<PclUtilities.IpTerminal> getIPTerminals()
        Method to get IP Terminals connected to the same network of the android device. Because it can take many time, best practice is to call it into a different thread that the main thread
        Returns:
        The list of IP terminals on the network

      • getIPTerminals

        public java.util.Set<PclUtilities.IpTerminal> getIPTerminals(android.os.Handler handler)
        Method to get IP Terminals connected to the same network of the android device. Because it can take many time, best practice is to call it into a different thread that the main thread
        Parameters:
        handler - to return new detected IP terminal with IPTERMINAL_MSG_KEY
        Returns:
        The list of IP terminals on the network

      • activateIpTerminal

        public int activateIpTerminal(PclUtilities.IpTerminal terminal)
        Activate a Ingenico ip terminal.
        Parameters:
        terminal - An IpTerminal object
        Returns:
        0 if IP terminal had been successfully activated else 1

      • getUsbCompanion

        public PclUtilities.UsbCompanion getUsbCompanion(android.hardware.usb.UsbDevice device)
        Get UsbCompanion object from an UsbDevice.
        Parameters:
        device - An UsbDevice
        Returns:
        An UsbCompanion
        See Also:
        PclUtilities.UsbCompanion, UsbDevice

      • getConnectedUsbCompanion

        public PclUtilities.UsbCompanion getConnectedUsbCompanion(android.hardware.usb.UsbDevice device)
        Get UsbCompanion object from an UsbDevice, only if it is connected
        Parameters:
        device - An UsbDevice
        Returns:
        An UsbCompanion
        See Also:
        PclUtilities.UsbCompanion, UsbDevice

      • getUsbCompanions

        public java.util.Set<PclUtilities.UsbCompanion> getUsbCompanions()
        Get connected Ingenico USB companions.
        Returns:
        A set of UsbCompanion corresponding to connected Ingenico USB terminals or null if USB host is not supported.
        See Also:
        PclUtilities.UsbCompanion

      • activateUsbCompanion

        public int activateUsbCompanion(java.lang.String name)
        Activate an Ingenico terminal connected through USB.
        Parameters:
        name - Ingenico terminal name. This name can be retrieved with getUsbCompanions.
        Returns:
        0 in case of success, 1 in case of failure

      • getActivatedCompanion

        public java.lang.String getActivatedCompanion()
        Gets activated companion name.
        Returns:
        The name of the activated companion (either the Bluetooth address or the terminal name)

      • isIngenicoUsbDevice

        public static boolean isIngenicoUsbDevice(android.hardware.usb.UsbDevice device)
        Returns whether an UsbDevice is an Ingenico terminal.
        Parameters:
        device - USB device
        Returns:
        true if the device is an Ingenico terminal

        Returns:
        UsbSerialPort
